title: Cat. 25  Milk Pot, 1765/76
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Myer Myers (American, 1723–1795)  
New York, New York  
Silver; 14 × 6.7 × 10.8 cm (5 1/2 × 2 5/8 × 4 1/4 in.)  
The Art institute of Chicago, restricted gift of the Antiquarian Society through Mrs. Dorothy Hale Dunbar, 1990.101

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On bottom (fig. 25.1)

Engraved on side: J M S within a cartouche (fig. 25.2)

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">With Jonathan Trace, Putnam Valley, NY, by 1990.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1990.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Yale University Art Gallery, New Haven, CT, Myer Myers: Jewish Silversmith in Colonial New York, September 14–December 30, 2001, pp. 170–71, 171 (ill.), cat. 76.

Skirball Cultural Center, Los Angeles, February 20–May 26, 2002.

Henry Francis du Pont Winterthur Museum, Wilmington, DE, June 20–September 13, 2002.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Rosenbaum (1954), p. 111.

Art Institute of Chicago (1990), p. 41, fig. 25.

Sotheby’s (1991), mentioned in lot 115.

Barquist, Butler, and Sarna (2001), pp. 170–72, 171 (ill.), cat. 76.

</section><section id="figures">Milk Pot, 1765/76.

fig. 25.1 fig. 25.2 </section>
